name: PlayerInventory
description: The PlayerInventory class provides comprehensive functionality for interacting with the player's survival inventory screen in Minecraft.
overview:
The PlayerInventory class provides comprehensive functionality for interacting with the player's survival inventory screen in Minecraft. This includes accessing the main inventory, hotbar, armor slots, offhand, crafting grid, and recipe book functionality. It extends the RecipeInventory class and inherits all standard inventory operations while adding player-specific inventory management features.

This class is automatically created when you open your inventory screen (typically with 'E' key) and can be accessed through Player.getInventory() or Inventory.create() when the survival inventory is open.

Inventory Layout:
- Hotbar: Slots 0-8 (9 slots)
- Main Inventory: Slots 9-35 (27 slots)
- Armor: Slots 5-8 (4 slots)
- Offhand: Slot 45
- Crafting Grid: Slots 1-4 (2x2)
- Crafting Output: Slot 0
- Crafting Book: Recipe book interface

constructors.description: Creates a new PlayerInventory instance for the player inventory screen. Primarily used internally by JSMacros.

methods.name: getHelmet
methods.description: Retrieves the item currently in the helmet armor slot.

methods.name: getChestplate
methods.description: Retrieves the item currently in the chestplate armor slot.
examples:
const inventory = Player.getInventory();
const chestplate = inventory.getChestplate();

methods.name: getLeggings
methods.description: Retrieves the item currently in the leggings armor slot.
examples:
const inventory = Player.getInventory();
const leggings = inventory.getLeggings();

methods.name: getBoots
methods.description: Retrieves the item currently in the boots armor slot.
examples:
const inventory = Player.getInventory();
const boots = inventory.getBoots();

methods.name: getOffhand
methods.description: Retrieves the item currently in the offhand slot.

methods.name: isInHotbar
methods.description: Checks if the specified slot index is within the hotbar section.

methods.name: getInput
methods.description: Retrieves the item in the crafting grid at the specified coordinates.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The x coordinate in the grid

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The y coordinate in the grid

methods.name: getOutput
methods.description: Retrieves the current output item from the crafting result slot.

methods.name: getInput
methods.description: Retrieves the entire crafting grid as a 2D array of items.
examples:
const craftingGrid = inventory.getInput();
const item = craftingGrid[0][0]; // Top-left slot

methods.name: getCraftingWidth
methods.description: Gets the width of the crafting grid (2 for PlayerInventory).

methods.name: getCraftingHeight
methods.description: Gets the height of the crafting grid (2 for PlayerInventory).

methods.name: getCraftingSlotCount
methods.description: Gets the total number of slots in the crafting grid.

methods.name: getInputSize
methods.description: Gets the size of the input area.

methods.name: getCategory
methods.description: Gets the current recipe book category.

methods.name: getCraftableRecipes
methods.description: Retrieves a list of recipes that can be crafted with current inventory items.

methods.name: getRecipes
methods.description: Retrieves recipes from the recipe book, optionally filtering for craftable ones only.

parameters.name: craftable
parameters.description: If true, returns only recipes craftable with current items

methods.name: isRecipeBookOpened
methods.description: Checks if the recipe book GUI is currently open.

methods.name: toggleRecipeBook
methods.description: Toggles the visibility of the recipe book.

methods.name: setRecipeBook
methods.description: Sets the open state of the recipe book.

parameters.name: open
parameters.description: True to open, false to close

methods.name: is
methods.description: Checks if the inventory matches a specific type.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The inventory type to check against (e.g., "Survival Inventory")

methods.name: getType
methods.description: Gets the type name of the inventory.

methods.name: getSlot
methods.description: Retrieves the item stack in a specific slot.

methods.name: getSlots
methods.description: Gets the slot indices for specific sections of the inventory.

methods.name: findFreeHotbarSlot
methods.description: Finds the first empty slot in the hotbar.
examples:
const freeSlot = inventory.findFreeHotbarSlot();
if (freeSlot !== -1) Chat.log("Found free slot at " + freeSlot);

methods.name: findFreeInventorySlot
methods.description: Finds the first empty slot in the main inventory.

methods.name: findFreeSlot
methods.description: Finds the first empty slot in a specific section.

methods.name: getSlotUnderMouse
methods.description: Gets the index of the slot currently under the mouse cursor.

methods.name: getLocation
methods.description: Gets the section name (location) for a specific slot index.
examples:
const location = inventory.getLocation(slotUnderMouse);
Chat.log("Slot location: " + location);

methods.name: contains
methods.description: Checks if the inventory contains a specific item.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The item ID to search for

methods.name: findItem
methods.description: Finds all slots containing a specific item.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The item ID to search for

examples:
const diamondSlots = inventory.findItem("minecraft:diamond");
Chat.log("Diamonds found in: " + diamondSlots.join(", "));

methods.name: getItemCount
methods.description: Returns a summary of counts for all items in the inventory.

methods.name: getItems
methods.description: Retrieves all items from specific sections of the inventory.

parameters.name: sections
parameters.description: The sections to retrieve items from

methods.name: click
methods.description: Simulates a left-click on a slot.

methods.name: click
methods.description: Simulates a click on a slot with a specific mouse button.

parameters.name: button
parameters.description: 0 for left click, 1 for right click

methods.name: quick
methods.description: Simulates a shift-click (quick move) on a slot.

methods.name: dropSlot
methods.description: Drops items from a specific slot.

parameters.name: all
parameters.description: True to drop stack, false to drop single item

methods.name: swapHotbar
methods.description: Swaps an item in the inventory with a specific hotbar slot.
examples: inventory.swapHotbar(9, 0); // Swap slot 9 with hotbar slot 1

methods.name: split
methods.description: Splits a stack of items from one slot to another.

methods.name: grabAll
methods.description: Double-clicks a slot to grab all matching items.

methods.name: dragClick
methods.description: Performs a drag-click operation across multiple slots.

parameters.name: slots
parameters.description: Array of slot indices to drag over

parameters.name: button
parameters.description: The mouse button (0 for left, 1 for right)

methods.name: getSelectedHotbarSlotIndex
methods.description: Gets the index of the currently selected hotbar slot (0-8).

methods.name: setSelectedHotbarSlotIndex
methods.description: Sets the currently selected hotbar slot.

methods.name: getHeld
methods.description: Gets the item currently held by the mouse cursor.
